quote: After a certain number of years our faces become our biographies. We get to be responsible for our faces.
An identity would seem to be arrived at by the way in which the person faces and uses his experience.
And when man faces destiny, destiny ends and man comes into his own.
Everyone faces the challenge of finding meaning to their suffering.
Faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.
After a certain number of years our faces become our biographies. We get to be responsible for our faces.
An identity would seem to be arrived at by the way in which the person faces and uses his experience.
And when man faces destiny, destiny ends and man comes into his own.
Everyone faces the challenge of finding meaning to their suffering.
Faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.
Genuine forgiveness does not deny anger but faces it head-on.
Glances of true beauty can be seen in the faces of those who live in true meekness.
I always have trouble remembering three things: faces, names, and - I can't remember what the third thing is.
Ignorance... is a painless evil; so, I should think, is dirt, considering the merry faces that go along with it.
It is the common wonder of all men, how among so many million faces, there should be none alike.
Life possesses an amazing array of profoundly sad faces.
Paganism is wholesome because it faces the facts of life.
People remain what they are even if their faces fall apart.
Show me a genuine case of platonic friendship, and I shall show you two old or homely faces.
The faces in New York remind me of people who played a game and lost.
The faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.
The truth has a million faces, but there is only one truth.
Their sighing , canting , grace-proud faces, their three-mile prayers, and half-mile graces.
Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
